events.title: Execution of King Louis XVI
events.description: King Louis XVI of France was executed by guillotine in Paris after being convicted of treason during the French Revolution.
events.significance: Marked the definitive end of the French monarchy and the rise of the French Republic, intensifying the Revolutionary Wars in Europe.

events.title: First X-ray in the United States
events.description: The first medical X-ray in the United States was made by Dr. John Hall-Edwards in Birmingham, England, marking the introduction of X-ray imaging in medical diagnosis.
events.significance: Revolutionized medical diagnosis and treatment, paving the way for modern radiology.

events.title: Formation of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People (NAACP)
events.description: The NAACP was founded to fight for civil rights and eliminate racial discrimination in the United States.
events.significance: Became one of the most influential civil rights organizations in American history, advancing racial justice.

events.title: British Capture Tobruk in World War II
events.description: British forces captured the strategic Libyan port city of Tobruk from Axis powers.
events.significance: Boosted Allied morale and disrupted Axis supply lines in North Africa.

events.title: Apple Introduces the First iPhone
events.description: Steve Jobs introduced the first iPhone at the Macworld Conference & Expo in San Francisco.
events.significance: Revolutionized the mobile phone industry and reshaped communication and computing worldwide.
